 I don't think that the Constitution specifically said anything on gay marriage (if I am wrong, please point it out). This means that the Constitution essentially leaves it open on the question of gay marriage. 
 
 The question is, then, whether it is reasonable to ban gay marriage, not whether it is allowable by the constitution to ban gay marriage -- and "it's reasonable because I think it's reasonable" is not a valid answer because it lacks reasoning. 
 
 With what you are allowed to do aside, why is it reasonable (and fair) to ban gay marriage? (I have no take on this -- haven't thought about it long enough)
 
 As an analogy: if I am correct, there is nothing in the Constitution that prevents people from repealing the first amendment (again, if I am wrong, please point it out). Would it be ok then to go ahead and repeal it? Sure, but would it be a reasonable thing to do? Probably not, as I am sure you would agree.

Because the gay agenda is to equate expression of hate with threats of illegal violence in an effort to make it illegal to express hate for sodomizers, male homosexuals, sodomy, etc. 
 
 This is the same sort of rot that the Southern States used before the Civil War to ban newspapers, etc., that were hateful toward slave owners and the slave system. The excuse was that such newspapers encouraged violence and hate in the slaves.

Got some news for you, YOU'RE WRONG.
 
 
 Totally unsubstantiated claim. Intelligent argument does not consist merely in saying (in bold caps) "you're wrong," but consists in giving reasons for your belief.
 
 
You make it sound as if half of the gay community are criminal rapists and the other half are unwilling victims.
 
 
 Data I imagine would be hard to come by as to the question of how many people who like being sodomized were originally sodomized as a result of forcible sexual abuse, since it stands to reason that the people so addicted to sodomy might be just as quiet with an interrogator as they presumably have been since they had the opportunity to seek conviction. And it is proverbial that forcibly sodomized people don't tend to speak out. This is one of the main reasons some of those priests who were in the news lately have been able to sodomize a hundred (at least) boys and then got away with it for a long while. So I don't think that an empirical pursuit of data along those lines would be very interesting or conclusive. Nor do I think that your observations (whatsoever they be) on this matter would be any more than a guess, either. Not that a good many of the males addicted into sodomy don't end up having homosexual relationships with males other than the male who originally abused them, but yeah, I would not be at all surprised if the majority of those males who "willingly" get sodomized have gotten this willingness because they were originally forcibly sodomized. I say this because it is the simplest assumption given my hypothesis that sodomy is an addiction, not because I have any meaningful data directly dealing with the matter, which as I mentioned, can't really be got. As for females, that would be a different matter. If my theory is correct, clearly the majority of people nowadays are clueless as to the true nature of sodomy. This ignorance might often cause females to stupidly try sodomy if their sex partner begs for it sufficiently--more especially inasmuch as (not my type) females sometimes try to behave submissively from a desire to show their man they are too lame and weak to commit adultery.

Even then, most will agree that it does not cause cravings like nicotine (in other words...nobody has sperm fits). You need to learn that what 2 consenting adults do behind closed doors is not your business.

I'd be the first to say there is an unfortunate lack of hate toward sodomizers in those who are submissive to them. The abused woman too afraid and guilty to leave her abuser and go to a woman's shelter, the gay male sodomized into homosexuality and a barren lifestyle because the monstrous parasite that dominates him wants his money--these unfortunates need to hate like nothing else.

 I would not be at all surprised if the majority of those males who "willingly" get sodomized have gotten this willingness because they were originally forcibly sodomized. I say this because it is the simplest assumption given my hypothesis that sodomy is an addiction, not because I have any meaningful data directly dealing with the matter, which as I mentioned, can't really be got. As for females, that would be a different matter. If my theory is correct, clearly the majority of people nowadays are clueless as to the true nature of sodomy. This ignorance might often cause females to stupidly try sodomy if their sex partner begs for it sufficiently--more especially inasmuch as (not my type) females sometimes try to behave submissively from a desire to show their man they are too lame and weak to commit adultery.
 
 
 So you are trying to say that the majority of the male homosexual population are rape victims? Good luck with that. 
 If find all of your logic flawed. Many women and their partners first experiment with anal sex through the use of toys. It seems to me that there is no sperm in a sex toy to cause your adiction. Many couples include such toys as a normal part of their sex life. Many women and men find anal stimulation pleasurable, this may be the reason so many continue to do it time after time.
step314

Many women and their partners first experiment with anal sex through the use of toys.
 
 
 Totally unsubstantiated codswallop. Saying something doesn't make it so. Are you saying that females have naturally a masturbatory view of rectal sodomy, or even more incredible, that they take pleasure in such masturbatory activity? So, for instance, there would be lots of sodomy-inexperienced virgin girls who pleasurably masturbate by putting things up their rectum? Not. Get a clue about what females are about before you start profaning them. What do you expect since you're nothing more than a little frightened homophobe. Most likely you're worried about your own sexuality and this is how you "compensate".

sundowner

Totally unsubstantiated codswallop. Saying something doesn't make it so. 
 1. Are you saying that females have naturally a masturbatory view of rectal sodomy, or even more incredible, that they take pleasure in such masturbatory activity? 
 
 2. So, for instance, there would be lots of sodomy-inexperienced virgin girls who pleasurably masturbate by putting things up their rectum? 
 
 Not. 
 
 3. Get a clue about what females are about before you start profaning them. 
 
 4. Try to figure out why girls tend on the whole to not be so tolerant of dirt and mess as males, and why, for instance, it would be such a big deal for a girl to have to wear a dirty dress to school; if you fail to see the obvious, consider that--hello--sodomy (and rectal sodomy in particular) is a dirty mess.

 
 1. Some do. Some males do as well.
 
 2. There would be some, many in fact. I did not say a majority, but there are many people who do find anal stimulation peasurable. 
 
 3. Who "profaned" females? By saying that some women like anal sex or stimulation is profane towards women? Get a grip. Many men and women, both straight and gay, enjoy anal sex / stimulation. Stating the truth is not profane.
 
 4. Are you serious?
mizmaxx

So, for instance, there would be lots of sodomy-inexperienced virgin girls who pleasurably masturbate by putting things up their rectum? 

 
 Are yuo saying there aren't? Find some evidence to back that up, then get back to us.
 
 You are the one coming up with outlandish theories. The onus of evidence is on you. Come up with some evidence to back up your fantastic claims, such as that oral intercourse is more related to sexual abuse/assault than other sexual activities. 
 
 I happen to know quite a bit on the subject of sexual abuse of children, and I am aware of many indicators of sexual abuse in children and past sexual abuse/assault in adults. Anal intercourse has never, to my knowledge, been shown to be more prevalent in abused children than other sexual activities. 
 
 Neither are survivors of same sex sexual abuse/assault more likely to be homosexual.
 
 In fact, the opposite is just as likely, as people who experience trauma tend to associate particular abusive acts with any kind of similar sexual activity. For example, having been abused mano-vaginally can cause a person to associate their feelings of fear/horror/pain/etc. with any suggestion/description/image/act of mano-vaginal stimulation.
 
 It is of course possible for people to do the opposite. This is more likely to occur if they were confused and further traumatized by feelings of physical pleasure during the assault. I am by no means saying that they "liked it", just that the body predictibly responds with pleasure signals when stimulated in certain ways, despite the fear/pain/horror/disgust/trauma of assault. Because survivors are so often told by the agressor and others, explicitely and implicitely, that they "asked for it" or "liked it", these healthy physical responses can cause serious guilt and confusion. In response, the person can identify with having "liked it" as a way to deny the loss of power and autonomy that are part of such assaults.
 
 However, and this is a BIG however, this is no more likely related to any one sex act than any other. 
 
 Therefore, a person who was sexually abused by anal penetration could engage in it in an unhealthy way (as they could engage in any sexual behaviour in an unhealthy way), but would just as likely feel the kind of aversion you demonstrate towards the act. 
 
 *For more info on real life sexual abuse survival (as opposed to academic shlock, which isn't hard to find), I highly recommend the books "The Courage to Heal: A Guide for Women Survivors of Child Sexual Abuse" (Ellen Bass and Laura Davis) and "Allies in Healing: When the Person You Love Was Sexually Abused As a Child" (Laura Davis). The first book is written for women, but many men find it helpful anyway.
